Technique: FORMED BY HAND; ENGRAVED; PAINTED; FAYENCE
Name: Cylindrical box
Description: This box in blue faience was acquired during the public sale of the MacGregor collection in London in 1921. Of cylindrical form, the piece is ornamented with a decoration  of chevrons, painted in black. It is very probable that the box was equipped with a lid, flat or conical. It dates from the New Kingdom.
